## Accounting policy

## Subsid/i.rightaries

Subsid/i.rightaries are all entit/i.rightes, includ/i.rightng structured entit/i.rightes, which the Group controls. The Group controls an entity when it is exposed to, and has rights to, variable returns from its involvement with the entity and has the abil/i.rightty to affect those returns through its power over the investee. The assessment of power is based on the Group's practical abil/i.rightty to direct the relevant activ/i.rightties of the entity unilaterally for the Group's own benefit and is subject to reassessment if and when one or more of the elements of control change. Subsid/i.rightaries are fully consolidated from the date on which the Group effectively obtains control. They are deconsolidated from the date that control ceases, and where any interest in the subsid/i.rightary remains, this is remeasured to its fair value and the change in carrying amount is recognised in the income statement.

## Associates and jo/i.rightnt arrangements

Joint arrangements are where two or more parties either have rights to the assets, and obligat/i.rightons of the jo/i.rightnt arrangement (jo/i.rightnt operations), or have rights to the net assets of the jo/i.rightnt arrangement (jo/i.rightnt venture). The Group evaluates the contractual terms of jo/i.rightnt arrangements to determine whether a jo/i.rightnt arrangement is a jo/i.rightnt operation or a jo/i.rightnt venture. The Group did not have any contractual interest in jo/i.rightnt operations.

## An associate is an entity over which the Group has sign/i.rightficant influence.

Investments in associates and jo/i.rightnt ventures are accounted for by the equity method of accounting and are in/i.righttially recognised at cost. The Group's investment in associates and jo/i.rightnt ventures includes goodwill ident/i.rightfied on acquis/i.righttion (net of any accumulated impa/i.rightrment loss).

The Group's share of its associates' and jo/i.rightnt ventures' post-acquis/i.righttion profits or losses is recognised in the income statement, and its share of post-acquis/i.righttion movements in other comprehensive income is recognised in reserves. The cumulative post-acquis/i.righttion movements are adjusted against the carrying amount of the investment. When the Group's share of losses in an associate or a jo/i.rightnt venture equals or exceeds its interest in the associate, includ/i.rightng any other unsecured receivables, the Group does not recognise further losses, unless it has incurred obligat/i.rightons or made payments on behalf of the associate or jo/i.rightnt venture.

Unrealised gains and losses on transactions between the Group and its associates and jo/i.rightnt ventures are elim/i.rightnated to the extent of the Group's interest in the associates and jo/i.rightnt ventures. At each balance sheet date, the Group assesses whether there is any object/i.rightve evidence of impa/i.rightrment in the investment in associates and jo/i.rightnt ventures. ## Accounting policy

A structured entity is an entity that has been designed so that voting or sim/i.rightlar rights are not the dominant factor in decid/i.rightng who controls the entity. Contractual arrangements determine the rights and therefore relevant activ/i.rightties of the structured entity. Structured entit/i.rightes are generally created to achieve a narrow and well-defined object/i.rightve with restrict/i.rightons around their activ/i.rightties. Structured entit/i.rightes are consolidated when the substance of the relationsh/i.rightp between the Group and the structured entity ind/i.rightcates the Group has power over the contractual relevant activ/i.rightties of the structured entity, is exposed to variable returns, and can use that power to affect the variable return exposure.

In determin/i.rightng whether to consolidate a structured entity to which assets have been transferred, the Group takes into account its abil/i.rightty to direct the relevant activ/i.rightties of the structured entity. These relevant activ/i.rightties are generally evidenced through a unilateral right to liqu/i.rightdate the structured entity, investment in a substantial proportion of the securit/i.rightes issued by the structured entity or where the Group holds specif/i.rightc subordinate securit/i.rightes that embody certain controlling rights. The Group may further consider relevant activ/i.rightties embedded with/i.rightn contractual arrangements such as call options which give the practical abil/i.rightty to direct the entity, special relationsh/i.rightps between the structured entity and investors, and if a single investor has a large exposure to variable returns of the structured entity.

Judgement is required in determin/i.rightng control over structured entit/i.rightes. The purpose and design of the entity is considered, along with a determinat/i.righton of what the relevant activ/i.rightties are of the entity and who directs these. Further judgements are made around which investor is exposed to, and absorbs the variable returns of the structured entity. The Group will have to weigh up all of these facts to consider whether the Group, or another involved party is acting as a princ/i.rightpal in its own right or as an agent on behalf of others. Judgement is further required in the ongoing assessment of control over structured entit/i.rightes, specif/i.rightcally if market condit/i.rightons have an effect on the variable return exposure of different investors.

The Group has involvement with both consolidated and unconsolidated structured entit/i.rightes, which may be established by the Group as a sponsor or by a third-party.
